intro: Monilaria ramulosa, commonly known as the ramose monilaria, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Verrucariaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically yellowish to orange in color and has a branched, leaf-like structure. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga, which contributes to its growth and survival in various environments. It is often found on rocks and soil surfaces in temperate regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to lichenologists and researchers studying symbiotic relationships.
